p: Most of the studied honey samples showed strong antimicrobial properties in inhibiting the growth of tested human pathogens at relatively lower concentration which averagely range from 10.5 ± 0.5–28.6 ± 0.9 of MIC (% v/v) ( Table 3). In regarded to the gram negative bacteria, the average MIC (% v/v) of the studied honeys samples averagely varied from 14.0 ± 0.7–25.5 ± 1.1% v/v ( Table 3).
